data.title: Who are the Top 10 Richest footballers in the world? (2024)

data.text:
In this article, we will review the top ten richest footballers in the world in 2024.

Football as we know it is one of the most lucrative sports in the world.

The beautiful game which is played in more than 200 countries worldwide is one of the most watched sports on the planet and has seen a host of football players across the globe achieve fame and fortune with a select number of superstars racking home millions of dollars yearly.

In this article, Pulse Sports reviews the Top 10 Richest footballers on the planet in 2024 by their Net Worth.

Revealed: Top 10 Richest footballers in the world (2024)

Full Name: Wayne Mark Rooney

Age: 39 (as of 2024)

Nationality: England

Net Worth: USD $170 million

Wayne Rooney is an English former professional footballer who played as a striker for Premier League club Manchester United, Everton and the England national team.

According to the 2012 France Football survey of the world’s best-paid players, Rooney is ranked fifth in the world and No.1 in England.

Rooney has played much of his career as a forward, and he has also been used in various midfield roles.

The 39-year-old Englishman was the record goalscorer for the England national team from 2015 to 2023.

He is also the all-time highest goal scorer in the history of Manchester United.

Rooney most recently managed Birmingham City having coached MLS club D.C United, and Championship club Derby County.

Rooney has endorsement deals with Nike, Nokia, Ford, Asda, and Coca-Cola.

He appeared on seven consecutive UK-version covers of Electronic Arts' FIFA video game series from FIFA 06 to FIFA 12.

As of 2024, Wayne Rooney’s net worth is approximately $170 Million, making him one of the richest soccer players in the world.

Kylian Mbappé is widely regarded as one of the most exciting football talents of his generation and one of the richest footballers in the world.

Mbappé’s meteoric rise to fame began when he joined AS Monaco's youth academy in 2013.

His remarkable speed, skill, and goal-scoring prowess quickly caught the attention of football enthusiasts worldwide.

Mbappé's breakthrough season came in 2016-2017, where he played a pivotal role in Monaco's Ligue 1 triumph and their impressive run to the semi-finals of the UEFA Champions League.

His performances earned him the prestigious Golden Boy award, recognizing him as the best young player in Europe.

In 2017, Mbappé made a high-profile transfer to Paris Saint-Germain (PSG), becoming one of the most expensive footballers in history.

His time at PSG has been marked by numerous domestic successes, including multiple Ligue 1 titles and domestic cup victories.

With PSG, he has won five Ligue 1 titles and three Coupes de France, including a domestic quadruple in the 2019–20 season, while also leading the club to its first ever UEFA Champions League final in 2020.

He is the club's all-time top goalscorer and ranks third all time in assists.

He is also the ninth-highest goalscorer in Ligue 1 history.

Mbappé finished in third place for the 2023 Ballon d'Or and was runner-up for the 2022 The Best FIFA Men's Player award.

He was named to the FIFA FIFPro World11 in 2018, 2019 and 2022, the UEFA Team of the Year in 2018 and the UEFA Champions League Squad of the Season in 2016–17, 2019–20, 2020–21 and 2021–22.

He was awarded the Golden Boy in 2017, the Kopa Trophy in 2018, and was shortlisted for the Laureus World Sportsman of the Year in 2019 and 2023.

Mbappé has been named Ligue 1 Player of the Year a record four times, and has finished as the Ligue 1 top scorer for a joint-record five seasons; in the 2021–22 season, he became the first player to finish as both Ligue 1 top scorer and top assist provider.

In 2023, he was ranked third on the Forbes list of the world's highest-paid athletes.

Internationally, Mbappé has been a key figure for the French national team, helping them secure victory in the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

His electrifying pace and clinical finishing make him a constant threat to opposition defenses.

Off the field, Mbappé's marketability is immense.

Mbappé has featured in EA Sports' FIFA video game series: on FIFA 18, he had the highest potential rating of 94.

His trademark goal celebration – posing with his arms folded and hands tucked under his armpits – was inspired by his younger brother Ethan, who would celebrate in this manner when beating Kylian at FIFA.

The celebration was first added in FIFA 19.

Mbappé featured as the cover star of FIFA 21, making him the youngest to appear on the cover solo also featured on the FIFA 22 and FIFA 23.

Mbappe exudes charisma and has a massive following on social media platforms.

He is the fourth most followed footballer on Instagram with over 112 million followers.

Off the field, Mbappé boasts endorsement deals with brands like Nike, Hublot, Oakley, others, contribute significantly to his wealth.

Mbappé's on-field success, coupled with his marketability and endorsement deals, has made him one of the richest footballers in the world.

As of 2024, he is the 9th richest footballer in the world with an estimated net worth of $180 million.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic is a Swedish footballer of Bosnian and Croatian descent.

Widely regarded as one of the greatest strikers of his generation, the 43-year-old Swede is one of the most controversial footballers in the world having last played for Serie A club AC Milan.

Ibrahimović is renowned for his acrobatic strikes and volleys, powerful long-range shots, and excellent technique and ball control.

He has scored over 570 career goals, including more than 500 club goals, and has scored in each of the last four decades, while making appearances for Malmo, Ajax, AC Milan, Inter, Juventus, Barcelona, Paris Saint Germain, Manchester United, and LA Galaxy.

In November 2019, it was announced that Ibrahimović had bought 23.5 percent of the shares in Hammarby IF, a Swedish top flight club from Stockholm.

During his four-season stay in France, he won four consecutive Ligue 1 titles, was the top scorer in Ligue 1 for three seasons and became PSG's all-time leading goalscorer at the time.

In 2016, he joined Manchester United on a free transfer and won his first European honour in his debut season. Ibrahimović joined American club LA Galaxy in 2018 and rejoined Milan in 2020, winning his fifth Serie A title in 2022.

Ibrahimović is one of eleven players to have made 100 or more appearances for the Swedish national team, over a 20-year international career.

He is the country's all-time leading goalscorer with 62 goals.

Ibra has been awarded Guldbollen (the Golden Ball), given to the Swedish player of the year, a record 12 times, including 10 consecutive times from 2007 to 2016.

Ibrahimović's 35-yard bicycle kick goal for Sweden against England won the 2013 FIFA Puskás Award, and is often considered one of the best goals of all time.

Ibrahimović was named in the FIFA FIFPro World XI in 2013 and the UEFA Team of the Year in 2007, 2009, 2013 and 2014.

He finished at a peak of fourth for the FIFA Ballon d'Or in 2013.

In 2015, UEFA included him as one of the best players that have not won the UEFA Champions League,

Ibrahimović is under contract with Nike and features in their television advertising where he has appeared in numerous ads alongside other players endorsed by the company.

He’s also very on social media, Zlatan has over 64 million Instagram followers, the most for a Swede.

As of 2024, Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s net worth is approximately $190 Million, making him the 7th richest footballer in the world.

Karim Benzema is a French professional footballer who plays as a striker for and captains Saudi Pro League club Al-Ittihad.

Popularly nicknamed “Big Benz’, he is widely regarded as one of the best strikers of all time.

Benzema is a creative forward known for his technical skills, vision and versatility on the field.

As of 2024, Benzema is Real Madrid's all-time second-highest goalscorer and top assist provider.

He won 24 trophies with Real Madrid, including four La Liga, three Copa del Rey, and five UEFA Champions League titles.

Born in Lyon to parents of Algerian descent, Benzema began his career with hometown club Lyon in 2005, contributing to three Ligue 1 title wins.

In 2008, he was named the league's Player of the Year and included in the Team of the Year having finished as the league's top goalscorer, winning his fourth league title and first Coupe de France.

In 2009, Benzema was the subject of a then-French record football transfer when he joined Real Madrid in a deal worth €35 million.

Having struggled to establish himself in his debut season, he eventually achieved a consistent goalscoring rate with the club, notably being part of a highly rated trio alongside Cristiano Ronaldo and Gareth Bale — dubbed "BBC" — who were integral to four Champions League wins between 2014 and 2018, under Zinedine Zidane and Carlo Ancelotti.

Following Ronaldo's departure in 2018, Benzema transitioned from the false 9 position into a sole striker.

He was named in the La Liga Team of the Season for five consecutive years from 2018 to 2023, won La Liga Best Player twice and the Pichichi Trophy for the first time in 2022, following Lionel Messi's exit from Barcelona.

Benzema finished as Champions League top scorer as he won his fifth title in 2022, and subsequently captained the club in his final season before signing for Al-Ittihad the following year.

With France, Benzema won the 2004 UEFA European Under-17 Championship and made his senior debut for Les Blues in 2007, at age 19.

He earned 97 caps, including scoring in three and appearing in four major tournaments, and ranks as France's sixth-highest all-time top goalscorer.

Benzema was controversially left out of the squad for the 2010 World Cup and did not play for France for over five years after being implicated in a blackmailing scandal in 2015; he later returned to the squad before announcing his international retirement in December 2022.

Big Benz has been named French Player of the Year by France Football four times.

For his performances in 2021 and 2022, Benzema was awarded the UEFA Player of the Year and the Ballon d'Or, becoming the fifth French player to have won the Ballon d'Or.

How does Benzema have so much money?

Benzema makes most of his income from the pitch, having signed lucrative deals over the last couple of years, notably with Real Madrid.

However, his transfer to the Middle East in the summer of 2023 saw his earnings sporadically increase in what placed him at the echelons of the highest-paid footballers of all time.

In June 2023, Karim Benzema signed a 2-year, $436 million contract with the Saudi Pro League club Al-Ittihad.

It is one of the largest contracts in sports history and equates to an average annual salary of $210million, before taxes.

Since evolving internationally, Benzema has participated in numerous advertising campaigns.

He was chosen as an ambassador of the American video game publisher Electronic Arts for the now-defunct FIFA series.

He has signed several sponsorship contracts, notably with the Korean automobile manufacturer Hyundai, the French telephone operator SFR and its subsidiary BuzzMobile, the French bank LCL and the sports betting company bwin.

Benzema is sponsored by Adidas.

In 2017, his documentary film Le K Benzema was released.

In 2020, Benzema started his own YouTube channel, uploading videos of his everyday life and sharing with fans.

In 2022, Benzema was named official ambassador of the Fendi Faster sneaker line.

'Big Benz' has also appeared in several campaigns for acclaimed international monthly men's magazine GQ, and is also considered amongst the most fashionable footballers in the world.

The French striker also racks in over a million dollars from sponsored ads on Instagram as he is one of the most followed footballers in the world.

As of 2024, Benzema is estimated to have a net worth of $200 million, making him one of the richest footballers in the world.

6. Dave Whelan (Net Worth) - $210 million

Full Name: Dave Whelan

Age: 87 years old (as of 2024)

Nationality: England

Club/Team: None, Wigan FC (former owner)

Category: Richest Footballers

Net Worth: USD $210 million

Dave Whelan began his career in the English football league and then retired to open a series of supermarkets.

The former left back has since become a successful businessman following his retirement in 1966, having played for Blackburn Rovers (from 1956 to 1960) and Crewe Alexandra (from 1962 to 1966).

Whelan is the former owner of club Wigan Athletic, having also been the chairman of the club for twenty years, before passing the position over to his grandson, David Sharpe, who eventually passed the ownership over to International Entertainment Corporation.

The 87-year-old Englishman owns a fishing sports store JJB Sports having purchased it in 1977.

Focusing on mainly sporting goods, JJB Sports became a chain of 7 stores by 1980. It is currently ranked as the UK’s second biggest sports retailer.

As of 2024, Dave Whelan’s net worth is estimated to be $210 Million, making him one of the wealthiest football players of all time.

Neymar is a Brazilian professional soccer player, and currently one of the most popular and influential soccer players in the world and widely regarded as the one of most naturally gifted players in the world.

Neymar has often been considered the third-best player in the Ronaldo-Messi era and one of the richest footballers in the world.

The 32-year-old talented playmaker currently plays for Al Hilal, having played for Paris Saint Germain, Santos FC and FC Barcelona with whom he won the treble in 2015.

Neymar finished third for the FIFA Ballon d'Or in 2015 and 2017, has been awarded the FIFA Puskás Award, has been named in the FIFA FIFPro World11 twice, the UEFA Team of the Year twice, and the UEFA Champions League Squad of the Season three times.

Off the pitch, he ranks among the world's most prominent sportsmen with a following of over 220 million on Instagram, making him the third most followed footballer on the planet.

Neymar has signed many sponsorship deals since his reputation began to grow from the age of 17.

In March 2011, he signed an 11-year contract with American sportswear company Nike, which ended in August 2020 after a Nike employee made a sexual assault complaint against him.

Neymar has since signed with German sportswear company Puma.

In March 2011, Panasonic paid US$2.4 million to secure Neymar's services for two years.

Prior to signing for Barcelona, has also signed other sponsorships from Volkswagen, Tenys Pé Baruel, Lupo, Ambev, Claro, Unilever and Santander.

Neymar was featured on the front covers of the video games Pro Evolution Soccer 2012 and Pro Evolution Soccer 2013 on the North American version.

Neymar also features in EA Sports' FIFA video game series, with the trailer for FIFA 18 showing him in his PSG home jersey, appearing alongside Cristiano Ronaldo on the Champions and Ultimate Edition packs for FIFA 19.

He has also appeared in movies like ‘XXX: Return of Xander Cage’ as himself and the popular Netflix crime series ‘Money Heist’ as Monje Joao.

As of 2024, Neymar Jr.’s net worth is approximately $250 Million, making him the 5th richest footballer in the world.

4. David Beckham (Net Worth) - $550 million

Full Name: David Robert Joseph Beckham

Age: 48 years old (as of 2024)

Nationality: England

Club/Team: Inter Miami CF (President and Co-owner)

Category: Richest Footballers | Most-Followed Footballers | Most-Followed Athletes

Net Worth: USD $550 million

David Robert Joseph Beckham is an English retired professional footballer from London.

He is the first English player to win league titles in four countries: England, Spain, the United States and France.

He has played for Manchester United, Preston North End, Real Madrid, Milan, LA Galaxy, Paris Saint-Germain, and the England national team, for which he held the appearance record for an outfield player until 2016.

Beckham is widely considered to be one of the most successful English players of all time.

He retired from professional football at the end of 2013.

The following year Beckham bought an MLS expansion team - Inter Miami for $25 million and also famously signed Lionel Messi in the summer of 2023.

Beckham's many endorsement deals make him one of the most influential athletes in the world.

Having worn Adidas football boots from the start of his career, in 2003 he signed a $160 million lifetime contract with Adidas, earning nearly half the money upfront, and will continue to earn percentages of profits on all of his branded Adidas products.

He had a 10-year collaboration with PepsiCo that expired in 2009. In 2021, he became a global ambassador for Italian luxury car brand Maserati.

The 48-year-old Englishman featured in EA Sports' FIFA video game series; he was on the cover for the UK edition of FIFA 98.

In November 2020, EA Sports had an agreement with Beckham to feature him in FIFA 21, in which he would earn £40m from a three-year deal.

During his playing career (which ended in May 2013), Beckham generated an estimated £1 billion in shirt and boot sales. And in 2006, Lloyd's of London insured his legs for £100m, at the time he was playing for Real Madrid.

In June 2020, Beckham became a minority owner of the London-based esports organization Guild Esports.

Beckham also has over 86 million Instagram followers, the most for a person from the UK and the fifth most followed football personality on the planet.

David Beckham turned the fortunes around of Inter Miami after moving to the Major League Soccer in one of the best business deals in sporting history.

Beckham bought Inter Miami for $25 million as a minority co-owner and raised the club's value to over $1 billion thanks to his popularity, business acumen and the acquisition of Argentine legend Lionel Messi.

As of March 2024, David Beckham’s net worth is estimated at $550 million, making him one of the richest footballers in the world and the richest English footballer of all time.

Cristiano Ronaldo is a Portuguese footballer, widely considered as the best footballer of all time.

The 39-year-old Portugal captain currently plays for Saudi Arabia league giants Al Nassr having sealed a mega-money move to the Middle East in December 2022.
